clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of Sofosbuvir and Daclatasvir Combo in COIVD-19 Patients in Egypt
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of Sofosbuvir and Daclatasvir Combo in COIVD-19 Patients in Egypt (Single Center Study)

brief_summary.textblock: Sofosbuvir has been recently recommended as a possible antiviral for COVID-19, based on structural studies and multiple alignment analysis. By comparing the positive-stranded RNA genomes of HCV and SARS-CoV-2, it has been postulated that sofosbuvir might be an optimal nucleotide analogue to repurpose for COVID-19 treatment

primary_outcome.measure: evaluate the combined effect of Sofosbuvir and Daclatasvir in treatment of patients with mild-moderate Covid-19.
primary_outcome.time_frame: it is estimated to be 2 weeks
primary_outcome.description: The study assesses the incidence of resolution of symptoms in COVID patients after taking Sofosbuvir and Daclatasvir for 14 days by doing PCR and the result to be negative

arm_group.description: A drug used in the treatment of HCV infection, given in the same dose 400mg and 60 mg respectively once daily for 14 days

intervention.description: Giving these two drugs for treatment of COVID patients

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- mild- moderate COVID-19 confirmed by PCR
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Patients on renal dialysis
2. Severe COVID-19 cases
3. Patients on amiodarone therapy (given the reported FDA warning of an interaction between amiodarone and sofosbuvir that might lead to severe bradycardia).
4. Children < 12 years
5. Pregnant and breast feeding women
6. Exacerbation of hepatitis B
